Taiwan: Chinese scholar Chen Di spends some time at the Bay of Tayouan (which Taiwan takes its name from) during a Ming dynasty anti-pirate mission and provides the first significant description of Taiwanese aborigines
Japan: Edo period starts after Tokugawa Ieyasu received from Emperor Go-Yōzei the title of shōgun.
Indonesia: First permanent Dutch trading post is established in Banten, West Java.
England: King James VI of Scotland ascends to the English throne, becoming James I of England and uniting the crowns - but not the parliaments - of the two kingdoms
Cuba: Authorities decree that the sale of tobacco to foreigners is punishable by death.
Burma: De Brito at Syriam declares independence from Arakan, repels Arakanese attacks (to 1605)
Armenia: Shah Abbas of Persia invades Ottoman Armenia (to 1618) and reestablishes full control over Eastern Armenia and large parts of Western Armenia as part of his empire.
